Yes, the interactive quality of a game can affect the trust of fans, as it can influence user engagement, satisfaction, and overall experience. The following references provide insights into how game interactivity relates to trust and fan engagement:

1. Nacke, L. E., Drachen, A., & Kuikkaniemi, K. (2010). The role of interactivity in games and the enjoyment of players. Computers in Entertainment (CIE), 8(2), 1-24.
	* This study explores how interactivity in games contributes to player enjoyment, which can be linked to building trust and loyalty among fans.

Abstract: Interactivity is a key element in the gaming experience, and this study investigates the relationship between interactivity, player enjoyment, and other factors influencing player engagement. The results show that high interactivity levels contribute to increased enjoyment, satisfaction, and positive affect, ultimately building trust and loyalty among fans.

1. Hamari, J., Koivisto, J., & Sarsa, H. (2014). Does gamification work? A literature review of empirical studies on gamification. In Proceedings of the 47th Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences, 3025-3034.
	* This literature review of empirical studies on gamification discusses the effects of gamification on user engagement and trust, highlighting the role of interactive elements in games.

Abstract: Gamification, the integration of game elements into non-game contexts, has gained popularity as a means of engaging users and enhancing their experiences. This literature review examines the effectiveness of gamification, with a focus on the role of interactive elements in fostering user engagement, satisfaction, and trust. The findings suggest that well-designed gamification strategies can contribute to improved user experiences, leading to increased trust and loyalty among fans.

1. Vorderer, P., Klimmt, C., & Ritterfeld, U. (2004). Enjoyment: At the heart of media entertainment. Communication Theory, 14(4), 388-408.
	* This paper discusses the concept of enjoyment in media entertainment, which can be relevant to understanding how the interactive quality of a game influences fan trust and engagement.

Abstract: This paper proposes that enjoyment is the core concept in media entertainment, encompassing various aspects of the user experience, including interactivity. By understanding the factors that contribute to enjoyment, such as the interactive quality of a game, we can better comprehend how trust and engagement among fans are affected. The paper suggests that well-designed interactive experiences can lead to increased fan trust and engagement.

These references should provide a starting point for understanding how the interactive quality of a game can affect fan trust. High interactivity can lead to greater enjoyment, satisfaction, and user engagement, which in turn can foster trust and loyalty among fans. However, it is essential to consider other factors, such as game design, content, and user preferences, to create a well-rounded gaming experience that appeals to fans.
